result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin Steve Drew was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Calvin Steve Drew is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Calvin Steve Drew was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of warrant cancellation commitment paid in full Fond du Lac County
Commitment amount paid in full -Fond du Lac County
Defendant's copy of Notice of Certification was returned undeliverable - Unable to Forward per USPS
Response Letter dated 01-11-16 to Defendant from Clerk

ADDRESS INFO for Calvin Steve Drew
Current: 63 Western Ave, c/o Fond du Lac County Jail, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 01-11-2016)
Prior: N6077 County Rd W, Fond Du Lac, WI 54937

Defendant Calvin Steve Drew in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Calvin Steve Drew in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 3.  State will move to dismiss Cts 1-2.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant enters No Contest plea.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 3.  
Counsel make sentencing arguments. Court questions defendant.  
BY THE COURT:  
Ct 3:  Court sentences defendant to serve 90 days in the Marquette County Jail, concurrent to any sentence he is currently serving.  Sentence to commence forthwith.  Huber granted.  May be served in Fond du Lac County if he is accepted.  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.  

Cts 1-2 are ordered dismissed.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is in Fond du Lac County Jail and will be released September 26th.  Atty Gumz states that there is no resolution at this time and asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that Mr. Drew is in the Fond du Lac County jail and serving a sentence until September 19th.  Atty Gumz has just been appointed and asks that the matter be reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

*Absolute sobriety, not to possess or consume alochol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  *Not to be on any premises licensed to sell alcohol.
***5/11/15:  Amended from cash to signature

Defendant Calvin Steve Drew in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant has charges pending in Fond du Lac County.  Atty Hendee states the Fond du Lac County charges to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court advises defendant that he will have to have a report date by end of business on Friday, May 15, 2015 to Fond du Lac County.  If defendant gets that date set; court will amend the bond to a $1,000 Signature bond with the same conditions.

Atty Hendee makes a statement to the court and asks that the bond not be modified.
BY THE COURT:  Courts order will stand.

Court questions the defendant regarding the Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.  Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
*Absolute sobriety, not to possess or consume alochol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  *Not to be on any premises licensed to sell alcohol.

Judge Slate and court reporter appear by phone.  Defendant Calvin Steve Drew in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states criminal complaint has been filed.  Court states he has not seen that yet.  Atty Hendee states charges and gives statement for probable cause.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for the charges.
Atty Hendee requests $5000 cash bond with conditions.  Mr. Drew makes statement on bond.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets cash bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
